steps.description: Check for responsiveness by tapping and shouting. If unresponsive, call emergency services (911).
Check the pulse by placing two fingers on the carotid artery (neck).
Lay the person flat on their back on a firm surface and begin chest compressions.
Position your hands: place one hand on top of the other and press hard and fast in the center of the chest.
Give 30 compressions at a depth of about 2 inches (5 cm), allowing full chest recoil between compressions.
Open the airway using the head-tilt, chin-lift technique.
Give 2 rescue breaths: pinch the nose, cover their mouth with yours, and blow until the chest rises.
Continue cycles of 30 compressions and 2 breaths until help arrives or the person starts breathing.
If breathing resumes, place them in the recovery position.
